intro: Philotheca gardneri subsp. globosa, commonly known as the globular philotheca, is a shrub native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its dense, spherical growth habit and small, aromatic leaves. The plant produces clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers during the spring and summer seasons. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
